title: 103_hr2662
content:
The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" establishes business activity targets for small businesses and modifies procurement procedures. The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" modifies procurement procedures by allowing participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals using restricted competition or price evaluation preferences. The authority granted remains in effect until September 30, 2000. Additionally, past development program participants are eligible for Section 8(a) contract awards. Section (8)(a)(1)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow awards to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period. This applies to both competitive and sole source awards under certain conditions. Additionally, the "Business Improvement Act of 1993" allows agencies to contract with these small businesses using restricted competition or price evaluation preferences until September 30, 2000. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by removing competitive contracts and eliminating subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if certain conditions are met. This includes having offers from at least 2 eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals, performing similar contracts under the same program, and the current contractor graduating from a development program before the solicitation is issued. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency under certain conditions. This includes restricting competition to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals upon request, with eligibility for award contingent on subcontracting agreements with minority small businesses. The agency must ensure compliance with subcontracting agreements after contract completion. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency. A follow-on contract for similar products or services will be awarded under the authority of this subsection. The term 'participating agency' refers to any Federal agency, and 'small business' is defined as a business concern with not more than 1500 employees. SEC. 7. Study of development program participation terms by industry sector; suspension of development program graduations. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a study on program participation terms for small businesses. Additionally, the suspension of development program graduations is extended for small businesses participating in certain programs. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a study on program participation terms for small businesses, extending the suspension of development program graduations until final regulations are issued or eligibility expires. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT.

Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act.

SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS.

The Administrator will establish uniform procedures within 120 days for contesting the status of small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals.
